body:
### Describe your issue

After upgrading rapidfuzz from Cython 3.0.12 to 3.1.3 some users started to run into the following ImportError:
```
#33 0.167   File "/etc/poetry/venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/rapidfuzz/_feature_detector.py", line 8, in <module>
#33 0.167     from rapidfuzz._feature_detector_cpp import AVX2, SSE2, supports
#33 0.167   File "src/rapidfuzz/_feature_detector_cpp.pyx", line 1, in init rapidfuzz._feature_detector_cpp
#33 0.167 TypeError: Metaclasses with custom tp_new are not supported.
```

The module is really simple:
```cython
# distutils: language=c++
# cython: language_level=3, binding=True, linetrace=True

from libc.stdint cimport uint32_t


cdef extern from "FeatureDetector/CpuInfo.hpp":
    cdef int CPU_FEATURE_SSE2
    cdef int CPU_FEATURE_AVX2

    cdef cppclass CpuInfo:
        @staticmethod
        bint supports(uint32_t features)

SSE2 = CPU_FEATURE_SSE2
AVX2 = CPU_FEATURE_AVX2

def supports(uint32_t features):
    return CpuInfo.supports(features)
```

In both reports it's on mac. It looks like the metaclass code is new in Cython 3.1 via https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6882 and https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6953.

@da-woods any idea what could be going wrong there

comment_data.body:
I can't trivially reproduce it (just by compiling the code you show above and CpuInfo.hpp). I don't have a mac though.

The metaclass we're using really shouldn't have a custom `tp_new`.

It is written into a publicly accessible place so it's possible that someone's monkey-patching it. This seems very unlikely though.

Do you know what version of Python they're using? I can't immediately see that in the bug reports I can find.
I guess at least Python 3.12 from your message above? But it'd be useful to know if it's wider than that.
Yes 3.13 non threaded. It doesn't occur in my build ci either.

The bug reports are:
- ~https://github.com/rapidfuzz/RapidFuzz/issues/454~ _(Edited by DW - probably separate)_
- https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/10526

Both of them are on mac os. The first one on arm the second one presumably on x64 (since `_feature_detector_cpp` only exists on x64 targets).

It was tested with the latest version of the project using Cython 3.0.12, 3.1.0, 3.1.1 and 3.1.3 and only doesn't cause this TypeError on 3.0.12. This also doesn't appear to be specific to the `_feature_detector_cpp` module, since it crashes on arm as well presumably in a different module.

Thanks.

I definitely can't see anything obviously wrong on a look through the metaclass code. (I spotted a minor ref-counting error, but it was just leaking a reference to a length-1 tuple, so nothing that'd cause problems).

If anyone's having the issue is prepared to do some debugging, I'd be interesting to know what `tp_new` ends up being.
Essentially:

```
try:
    import rapidfuzz
except:
    import sys
    cy_module = sys.modules['_cython_3_1_3_mon']  # this name might vary a little bit
    mc = cy_module._common_types_metatype
    # then either:
    mc()
    # or
    class C(metaclass=mc): pass
```

On my laptop I get `TypeError: cannot create '_cython_3_1_3_mon._common_types_metatype' instances` which is what I'd expect.  If it's overwritten by something arbitrary, I'd expect a hard crash. Otherwise, maybe it'll work?

@nitsujri can you give this a try?

`mc = cy._common_types_metatype` should be `mc = cy_module._common_types_metatype`

> `mc = cy._common_types_metatype` should be `mc = cy_module._common_types_metatype`

Sorry - yes edited.

Morning guys, did a local build of RapidFuzz using Cython 3.1.3: https://pastebin.pl/view/daa1522c

I couldn't get past the `import RapidFuzz`.

Video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tCzaymITmR4JwF0uz1ldWHUa6KN1-VDv/view?usp=sharing

I gave it another go of doing the same imports directly.

I could get this error once and then never again (cached?).

- Running `mc()` https://pastebin.pl/view/2fffeab0
- Running `class C(metaclass=mc)` https://pastebin.pl/view/e0672b6a

The imports i tried at various times:

- `from rapidfuzz.distance import OSA`
- `from rapidfuzz._feature_detector import AVX2`
- `from rapidfuzz._feature_detector_cpp import AVX2, SSE2, supports`

I can reproduce the crash on Linux. It also occurs for me when running with rapidfuzz 3.14.0 from the vs code debugger.

```
Exception has occurred: TypeError
cannot create '_cython_3_1_3_mon._common_types_metatype' instances
KeyError: (1, '/home/max/.local/lib/python3.13/site-packages/src/rapidfuzz/_feature_detector_cpp.pyx', <code object PyInit__feature_detector_cpp at 0x7f8ebb13bd20, file "src/rapidfuzz/_feature_detector_cpp.pyx", line 1>)

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

  File "/home/max/Workspace/cython/run.py", line 4, in <module>
    import rapidfuzz
AssertionError: <code object _call_with_frames_removed at 0x7f8eca524570, file "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 480> != <code object PyInit__feature_detector_cpp at 0x7f8ebb13bd20, file "src/rapidfuzz/_feature_detector_cpp.pyx", line 1>

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

  File "/home/max/Workspace/cython/run.py", line 10, in <module>
    mc()
    ~~^^
TypeError: cannot create '_cython_3_1_3_mon._common_types_metatype' instances
```

The issue also only starts appearing once I set a first breakpoint within the script. Before that it runs just fine.
Also not sure why the exception doesn't always occur for the same module even though the import order would be the same + it sometimes catches it as an exception and sometimes just exits the program

Thanks - so both of you get `TypeError: cannot create`, which is exactly what I'd expect. However in both cases you aren't seeing the metaclass error.

In fact I can't see any references at all to the metaclass in https://github.com/rapidfuzz/RapidFuzz/issues/454. So I'm not sure it's the same issue as https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/10526.

Which doesn't help because now I think there are two issues (of which probably only 1 is my fault)

I can reproduce the issue with VSCode debugger.  The error there looks to be

```
AssertionError: <code object _call_with_frames_removed at 0x7c7e67cbc570, file "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 480> != <code object PyInit_rapidfuzzbug at 0x7c7e661f9d70, file "rapidfuzzbug.pyx", line 1>
```

I'm pretty sure that's unrelated to metaclasses.
The VSCode debugging issue bisects to ed2b40be6cad736ab39cffa2503d816ef2c6741e

I've opened a new issue for the VSCode debugging: https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/7133. I've also hidden the comments here that I believe refer to it. So I'll leave this issue purely for the metaclasses, which I think are separate.

This other related report I can find on Github is https://github.com/apache/doris-mcp-server/issues/43.  It's a little light on details, but based on the paths it looks to be Mac again. It also looks to be a beta version of Python 3.12 which may/may not be interesting (we certainly don't care about supporting beta versions)

Right - I can reproduce this on Python 3.12 beta 2. I can't reproduce this on Python 3.12.0.  Therefore I think this is not a Cython bug and will close the issue.

Please ping me to reopen if you get more information that contradicts this conclusion.

title: ImportError with `Metaclasses with custom tp_new are not supported.`
